div.p: Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.
More information can be found at Ruby home.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin calls the Ruby tool via command line and passes the user-provided parameters.

The @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin is totally open, because it allows the input of any kind of Ruby command, defined in the provided TextArea or within a file, when writing the command in the TextArea is important to remember to use correct Ruby syntax.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes or radio buttons, hitorical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested against Ruby version 1.9.3.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

This procedure allows the input of any Ruby command. When the Command is defined the Ruby command is created and run into the Commander, displaying at the end the result of it. It creates a log file, which contains the output generated by the console.
The Fields 'Input Type' and 'Command' are totally dependent, because the selected type must match the command provided or otherwise it will not work.

tr.td: Option to provide the local path to the Ruby.exe file, if required.

Select the type of input that is going to be provided in the 'Command' field. There are two options, the first one is called "command" which suggest that the input will be a raw command in the 'Command' field, the second one is called "file(path)" which suggest that the input will be the path of the file in the 'Command' field.(Required)
Provide the Ruby command to execute. Remember to use correct Ruby syntax when using a command.(Required)

div.p: The log file prints out the same output that the console would print.
